item.title: How to Upgrade Tools in Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time
item.description:
Each Life/Class in Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time has its own equipment. Combat Lives use weapons such as swords and staves, Gathering Lives use tools for collecting resources (ex: Axe), and Crafting Lives' tools can only be used during crafting minigames.

You'll collect basic weapons/tools when you reach Fledgling rank in any Class. They won't have any skills and will always be ordinary ranking. To get a Good or Great rank on your gear in Fantasy Life i , you'll need the right Crafting Life for the job.

Gathering and Crafting Lives

Which Lives Can Make Tools, Weapons, etc.

In Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time , you'll have 14 different Lives to choose from. A Life is basically a Class where you learn different skills that can be used in the overworld. Fantasy Life i has three categories for Classes:

Life

Gathering

Woodcutter, Miner, Angler, Farmer

Crafting

Carpenter, Blacksmith, Alchemist, Tailor, Painter, Cook

Combat

Paladin, Mercenary, Hunter, Magician

The Painter Life and Farmer Life are not readily available at the start of the game. You'll need to progress through the main story to unlock them.

As their category indicates, Crafting Lives such as the Carpenter Life allow you to make various tools, weapons, and armor from materials you obtain through Gathering Lives . Thus, when it comes to making Good/Great/Top Quality gear, you'll need to put some effort into your Crafting Lives and Gathering Lives.

Specifically, you should focus on these Lives:

  • The Miner Life allows you to break open the ore deposits you'll see in each overworld of Fantasy Life i . You'll want to raise your Miner level and get stronger tools and skills to break open the higher-leveled deposits.
  • Woodcutter arms you with an axe to hack down a variety of trees to collect different types of wood that can then be turned into materials to make tools.
  • Tailoring is sometimes required for making cloth materials that are used in certain armor recipes, such as a Cape.
  • Carpenter Life is how you make tools/equipment as well as furniture for your Base Camp and House.
  • The Blacksmith Life uses minerals you get via the Miner Life to create ingots, which can then be used to make swords and other 'metallic' tools/weapons.

How to Get Excellent in Crafting Minigame

How to Get Good Quality

To create Good, Great, and Top Quality gear, you just need to interact with a Crafting Station . Each Life has its own HQ/base in Eternia Village. It's also recommended you equip stronger tools. For example, try using an Oak Saw instead of the 'borrowed' saw you received at the start of the Carpenter Life fledgling quest.

When you select an item to craft, you'll notice the Crafting Life icon next to a number at the bottom of the screen. This number indicates the Recommended Crafting Skills . On the left screen, you'll see your Crafting Skills . To ensure a better tool, you want your Crafting Skills to be close to this level or higher. Your Crafting Skills can be enhanced by leveling, unlocking skills in the Skill Tree, or by equipping a tool with a high Crafting Skill number.

Crafting Minigame Explained

Once you've selected your tool and crafting recipe, you'll be thrown into a minigame where you have to select the correct 'station' in time with the button prompts. You'll have a set number of turns that requires you to all given actions within the time limit . This number appears in the top-right corner of your screen. The time limit bar is in the middle, and it will also display the next station/prompt. To complete a prompt, you need to tap, hold down, or repeatedly tap the action button.

At the end of the minigame, you'll receive a ranking of Failure, Done, Good, Great, or Perfect depending on your performance.

You'll get a Good Quality craft item by doing any (or all) of the following:

  • Make sure your Crafting Skills are near/equate to or exceed the crafting recipe's Recommended Crafting Skills number.
  • Get Great and Excellent scores during the minigame. Avoid Good and avoid running out of time.
  • Using a tool of a higher rank (ex: Fine) or higher quality (ex: Good). Sometimes higher rank/quality tools come with skills that can extend your crafting time, etc.

Also, keep in mind that a tool's Rank is not the same as a tool's Quality . When you choose a weapon or tool to craft, you'll be able to select from Ordinary, Fine, or (if you unlocked it) Notable. While a Fine tool with no quality is better than an Ordinary tool with no quality, it's not always better than an Ordinary tool with a Good Quality. Furthermore, if you're trying to craft Good Quality items for quests, you should just stick with the Ordinary Rank.

After you start gathering Strangelings and return them to normal, you can have them help you with crafting. This will boost your Crafting Skills for that session, and you can switch between characters during the minigame.

Crafting Skills to Level Up

You should be using the Skills menu for each Crafting Life. Nodes contain Skills that extend crafting time, add more Skill Points, and even unlock special moves that can auto-complete lower-leveled crafting recipes. It's also recommended you work on unlocking the Spin and Hold nodes, since these take longer to complete than simply tapping the action button.

Using Auto-Complete will not give you high-quality items (ex: gear with Good Quality) or give you more items (ex: Logs).

Best Equipment to Upgrade First

Recommended Tools and Armor

Generally, you should focus on getting Good quality tools such as the Saw (Carpenter) , Hammer (Blacksmith) , and Needle (Tailor) . Because all three Crafting Lives make materials and equipment, it's highly recommended you have tools that will increase your total Skill number.

Next, you should work on forging stronger weapons , mainly for whichever Combat Life you prefer. If you like the Magician Life, then craft some Fine Pine Rods and aim for good quality. Tools, weapons, and armor with good/great/top quality marks will come with additional skills , such as elemental damage/protection, enhanced SP, and more.

14 Images

item.title: Tales of the Shire Should Be More Like Hello Kitty Than Animal Crossing in One Way
item.description:
While previews have already given gamers a good look at Tales of the Shire , some of the game's features have yet to be fully revealed. Players know the title will feature standard simulation gameplay, like farming, collecting resources, fishing, and cooking, but some details about its NPCs, decorative furniture and clothing, and events are still unknown. Hopefully, when these details about Tales of the Shire are finally revealed, it will be clear that developer Weta Workshop has been taking inspiration from other titles in the simulation genre.

Several big-name IPs have entered the realm of simulation games over the last few years, with Disney Dreamlight Valley and Hello Kitty Island Adventure being two key examples. These games have clearly paved the way for Tales of the Shire , which turns Tolkein's world into a life sim, and they are perfect sources of inspiration for the game, perhaps even more so than simulation giants like the Animal Crossing franchise. In fact, Hello Kitty Island Adventure should directly inspire one aspect of Tales of the Shire : its approach to events.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure Keeps Events on a Steady Rotation

Hello Kitty Island Adventure has a lot of events, and they come in four different types; primary events that last between five and six weeks, secondary events that are shorter, flash events that last one to two days, and the daily calendar. These events are accessible to all players, regardless of how far they have progressed in the game. Five to six weeks may seem like a long stretch of time, but with multiple events sometimes running concurrently, Hello Kitty Island Adventure always feels like it has new content to offer its playerbase. Most of the events in Hello Kitty Island Adventure involve earning the event’s specific currency by completing daily quests, interacting with characters, or finding them around Seaside Resort. Players can then claim their rewards via daily login, the event stand, or the shop.

The frequency of Hello Kitty Island Adventure ’s events is specifically what Tales of the Shire should emulate. In contrast to this approach is Animal Crossing: New Horizons , which has limited events that coincide with real-world holidays and those that have been established over the course of the series, such as the fishing tourney and bug-off. Of course, holidays are a great excuse to add an event to a game, but Hello Kitty Island Adventure is proof that constantly offering new gameplay experiences via events is a great way to keep players engaged.

Tales of the Shire Should Adopt HKIA's Approach

Tales of the Shire should have seasonal events that are rooted in canon celebrations from the Tolkienverse, like the Hobbit holidays Yule and Liteh, but that should not be the end of things. Simple collection events, like a harvest competition, a cook-off, or a fishing tourney, could be the perfect way to bring even more activities to the game. While little information about this aspect of Tales of the Shire has been officially shared, despite the early previews that are available, events that incorporate the types of gameplay that have been revealed, like fishing, farming, and foraging, seem like the most obvious route for the game to take.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure and the Animal Crossing franchise take different approaches to the simulation genre, and they both have features that Tales of the Shire should take inspiration from. However, when it comes to events, the upcoming life sim should definitely look to replicate Hello Kitty Island Adventure 's approach rather than Animal Crossing 's.

item.title: Gears of War: Reloaded Could Be Getting a Multiplayer Beta
item.description:
Summary

  • A new SteamDB listing for a potential Gears of War: Reloaded multiplayer beta has surfaced online.
  • The multiplayer beta could give players the opportunity to test out Gears of War: Reloaded's modes and maps before launch.
  • Gears of War: Reloaded will be available on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC for $39.99 on August 26.

A new SteamDB listing for Gears of War: Reloaded potentially points toward a multiplayer beta, allowing PC gamers to test out the new remaster before it launches this August. Developed in partnership with Sumo Digital and Disbelief, Xbox and The Coalition's Gears of War: Reloaded aims to revitalize the original Gears of War game with several major improvements and features.

On May 5, Xbox announced that Gears of War: Reloaded would be released on August 26 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC for $39.99. The game's release will mark the franchise's debut on PlayStation platforms, and Xbox gamers who already owned the digital version of Gears of War: Ultimate Edition before May 5 are entitled to a free upgrade. The game will also be a day one addition to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass, so players have multiple avenues towards playing the game this August. In addition, a new SteamDB listing suggests that players will have the opportunity to play a Gears of War: Reloaded multiplayer beta in the coming weeks.

A new Gears of War: Reloaded multiplayer beta listing has surfaced on SteamDB, as reported by Comicbook.com. The beta listing was added on May 22 with the official Steam page for Gears of War: Reloaded being the parent app, and it was later updated on May 23. The SteamDB page doesn't reveal any specific details about the content, modes, or maps included in the beta, but the page does show that a private branch for the beta was created, which could possibly be for testing by the Gears of War: Reloaded developers.

SteamDB Lists a Gears of War: Reloaded Multiplayer Beta

Although Xbox has not confirmed if the beta is officially on the way, many of the supported features for Gears of War: Reloaded's multiplayer have been confirmed so far. Gears of War: Reloaded will support 120 FPS in multiplayer, along with variable refresh rate and support for up to 4K resolution. The remaster also supports cross-play between Xbox, PlayStation, and PC in campaign co-op and multiplayer, and players who choose to link a Microsoft account to the remaster gain access to cross-platform progression, allowing them to continue their multiplayer progress across devices.

Moreover, Xbox and The Coalition are working on Gears of War: E-Day , the prequel to Gears of War , with co-developer People Can Fly. Gears of War: Reloaded could be the key to the resurgence that fans have been wanting for the franchise, and the multiplayer beta could leave lasting positive impressions before the full game and Gears of War: E-Day are released.

item.title: Hogwarts Legacy's Sequel Should Go All or Nothing on Quidditch
item.description:
Hogwarts Legacy has enjoyed a level of success not afforded to most games, but such success comes with a cost: all eyes will be on its sequel to deliver an expanded, improved experience. Indeed, the first Hogwarts Legacy had the benefit of being a bold new Harry Potter adaptation, but Hogwarts Legacy 2 has to shoulder the weight of expectation.

Luckily (or not so luckily, depending on perspective), there are plenty of clear shortcomings that the Hogwarts Legacy sequel can target. Aside from assorted narrative and gameplay woes, there are a number of obvious features and lore-relevant concepts that ought to be added to the original formula. As many have already suggested, more interactive classroom segments ala Bully or Persona could go a long way toward driving home the fantasy of being a magical schoolgoer, but one crucial aspect of the Harry Potter experience needs to be stirred into the mix as well.

Why Quidditch Will Be Important in Hogwarts Legacy 2

Quidditch Is a Glaring Omission in Hogwarts Legacy

One of the strangest missing features of Hogwarts Legacy is quidditch, the famous airborne wizard sport that combines elements of soccer, cricket, and water polo. It's not entirely clear why Avalanche Software opted to leave quidditch out of the final cut of the game, though many have speculated that it was to make room for Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions , a standalone game designed around the sport. But even though Quidditch Champions has already been released, and regardless of its potential for growth as a live-service title, Hogwarts Legacy 2 should still welcome the game into the fold, as it has a lot of potential within the RPG framework.

Quidditch is written out of Hogwarts Legacy in a rather awkward way, with Headmaster Black declaring the season canceled after a pure-blood student was injured on the pitch.

Quidditch Could Greatly Improve the Hogwarts Legacy 2 Experience

While it definitely has some shortcomings, chief among them a general lack of depth and content, Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions is surprisingly fun and well-designed. It's a respectable translation of a sport that, obviously, no one has ever actually played, and its physics, controls, and slight rule tweaks help the game feel intuitive and expressive. But at the end of the day, even with potential updates and ambitious expansions, Quidditch Champion s will likely never match the bold expansiveness of a full-blown RPG like Hogwarts Legacy .

Quidditch could be introduced into the broader RPG formula of Hogwarts Legacy as an exciting optional side activity. Perhaps players could engage with the sport in a similar manner as guilds in The Elder Scrolls , for instance: quidditch could have its own dedicated quest chain, progression, and narrative, which would be steered by the player for a more complete role-playing experience. This could greatly elevate the fantasy of being a Hogwarts student, as players would have the option to pursue the sporty character archetype while mastering a new gameplay facet.

One could make the case that quidditch is more than just a cool potential feature for Hogwarts Legacy 2 ; it's a borderline necessity for the sequel. The fact that there is no quidditch in the first game is puzzling, but forgivable, especially in light of the standalone Quidditch Champion s , but it would, quite frankly, not make any sense for the sport to be absent during the second go-around. In the worst case scenario, skirting around quidditch yet again could make it seem like Avalanche Software is withholding a potentially transformative aspect of the RPG sandbox for no other reason than to funnel players into the live-service Quidditch Champions , which would be frustrating and immersion-breaking to say the least.

Hogwarts Legacy is an immersive, open-world action RPG set in the world first introduced in the Harry Potter books. For the first time, experience Hogwarts in the 1800s. Your character is a student who holds the key to an ancient secret that threatens to tear the wizarding world apart. Now you can take control of the action and be at the center of your own adventure in the wizarding world. Your legacy is what you make of it.

Explore an Open World
The wizarding world awaits you. Freely roam Hogwarts, Hogsmeade, the Forbidden Forest, and the surrounding Overland area.

Be the Witch or Wizard You Want to be
Learn spells, brew potions, grow plants, and tend to magical beasts along your journey. Get sorted into your house, forge relationships, and master skills to become the witch or wizard you want to be Experience a New Wizarding World Adventure
Experience the wizarding world in an unexplored era to uncover a hidden truth from its past. Battle against trolls, Dark Wizards, goblins, and more as you face a dangerous villain threatening the fate of the wizarding world.

Cross-Platform Play
Hogwarts Legacy doesn't have crossplay or crossplatform support
Cross Save
you can freely use your saved data between each console as long as you are connected to the internet and signed into the same account where the saved data was created

item.title: Pokemon TCG Shirts Are Coming to Uniqlo
item.description:
Summary

  • Uniqlo partners with Pokemon TCG to release new adult and kids' shirt collection featuring iconic Pokemon.
  • The shirts, priced at $7 to $21 USD, will be available in Japanese Uniqlo stores starting August, with global availability expected.
  • This collaboration is the second line of Pokemon clothing announced by Uniqlo in 2025, offering fans a variety of collectibles and garments.

Uniqlo is partnering up with the Pokemon Trading Card Game to produce a new line of shirts for the popular fashion retailer. The new collection features nine Pokemon TCG shirts for adults and eight for kids, including both T-shirts and sweatshirts.

Pokemon and Uniqlo have a history, as the retailer has previously sold shirts with Pokemon designs on them. That's far from the only partnership the Japanese retailer has had, though, as popular game franchises have partnered with Uniqlo for shirts based on Final Fantasy , Street Fighter , Tekken , and anime like Attack on Titan , Chainsaw Man , and the extensive Gundam franchise.

Now, Uniqlo is announcing a series of new shirts that are based off of Pokemon TCG and Pokemon TCG Pocket . For adults, five t-shirts and four sweatshirts have been announced, while the children's collection features four t-shirts and four sweatshirts. Some of the designs are available in both collections, but some are unique to their individual age group. The adult designs feature Pokemon like Gengar, Pikachu, Mewtwo, Snorlax, Slowpoke, Unown, Magikarp, Omanyte, Gardevoir. The kids' collection includes similar designs of Mewtwo and Pikachu, as well as unique designs featuring Mew, Mimikyu, Lapras, Lucario, Eevee, and Charizard.

Pokemon Trading Card Game x Uniqlo Shirt Collaboration Pricing and Availability

At the moment, these shirts have only been announced for Japanese Uniqlo locations starting in August, but they will likely be made available worldwide simultaneously or at a later date. The adults' shirts will retail for 1500 yen, or roughly $11, with sweatshirts going for 2990 yen, or about $21 USD. The kids' shirts are priced lower, at 990 yen (about $7) for a t-shirt or 1990 yen (about $14) for a sweatshirt. The Uniqlo collection will include sizes from XS to XXXXL.

Pokemon promotional tie-ins never seem to stop, giving fans of the franchise a never-ending supply of collectibles and garments to choose from. This is the second line of Pokemon clothing at Uniqlo set to arrive in 2025 so far, with the Pokemon Sketch Uniqlo collection having been announced earlier in the year. Of course, there are also numerous Pokemon clothing options available from The Pokemon Center and other retailers, as well, ensuring that fans have a wide variety to choose from. Some fans have also gone so far as to make their own clothing based off of Pokemon . There seems to be no shortage of fans who enjoy wearing their favorites on their sleeves - sometimes literally.
